thread.title: It’s Almost Time to #RockTheDots – This Sunday, January 22, at Disney Springs and Downtown Disney!
thread.title_full: It’s Almost Time to #RockTheDots – This Sunday, January 22, at Disney Springs and Downtown Disney!

author: Darcy Clark
title: It’s Almost Time to #RockTheDots – This Sunday, January 22, at Disney Springs and Downtown Disney!
text:
Last week, I told you about a first-of-its-kind celebration at Disney Parks honoring one of my favorite global fashion icons, Minnie Mouse, on National Polka Dot Day . This Sunday, January 22, you’re invited to visit Disney Springs at Walt Disney World Resort and Downtown Disney District at the Disneyland Resort dressed in your favorite polka-dotted ensemble to enjoy a day of fashionable fun!
At Disney Springs, dance along to special entertainment from 1-5 p.m. at Town Center and pose for fun photo opportunities. Plus, guests dressed in polka dots can enjoy special discounts and offers. Two of my favorites include 50% off admission to DisneyQuest and complimentary stitching when you purchase a Minnie Mouse “Dot” ear hat at Disney’s Wonderful World of Memories from 12-5 p.m.
Guests in polka dots can also receive a special commemorative button (while supplies last) from these locations:
The Welcome Center Marketplace Co-Op Tren-D World of Disney Disney’s Wonderful World of Memories DisneyQuest Select participating retailers Additional one-day only promotions are available at the following Disney Springs locations, so be sure to dress the part to take full advantage of the festivities! 
At Downtown Disney, a DJ dance party will take place from 1-5 p.m. at the Downtown Disney Live! Stage and special photo opportunities will be available. A commemorative button will also be available at World of Disney, Marceline’s Confectionary and Vault 28 (while supplies last)! Entertainment is subject to change, but our participating retailers and restaurants will be rocking the dots all-day – rain or shine!
You can view all the special discounts and featured merchandise at Downtown Disney District by clicking here . 
Need some fashion inspiration? Minnie Mouse revealed her newest dress last night on the “mousewalk!” The dress was designed by fashion designer Olympia Le- Tan and was inspired by the upcoming UNIQLO x Olympia Le-Tan and Disney Collection that will be hitting stores in the spring.

And, check out this brand-new video by fine art photographer Gray Malin, inspired by Minnie Mouse.

I can’t wait to see how you #RockTheDots, so plan to share your photos on social media this Sunday!
